meanings.definition: The striking of one solid object with or against another.
meanings.sent1: The loud percussion of the hammer against the nail echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The percussion of the drumsticks on the drum created a rhythmic beat.
meanings.sent3: The percussion of the spoon against the bowl made a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: Her heart raced with the percussion of excitement in her chest.
meanings.sent5: The percussion of the rain on the roof was soothing and calming.

meanings.definition: Musical instruments played by striking or shaking.
meanings.sent1: The band included various percussion instruments like drums and cymbals.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed playing percussion in the school band, especially the tambourine.
meanings.sent3: The percussion instruments seemed to have a conversation of their own.
meanings.sent4: The percussion of the xylophone notes danced in the air like colorful butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The percussion section added depth and energy to the orchestra's performance.
